task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 61°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building’s full height accurately, I need to see the roofline and ground reference, so I will tilt the view upward while keeping the same heading.
The view heading has shifted to due north, so I need to rotate back to the building at ~61° NE while keeping an upward pitch to capture the roofline for height estimation.
To estimate total height I need the roofline in view, so I will tilt up while staying aligned with the building at ~62°.
The heading keeps snapping back to 0° when pitching, so I should rotate to ~62° at the current 30° pitch to keep the building in frame.
Since pitching up seems to reset the heading, I'll move closer to the building to better judge scale from façade features (floors/windows) at this stable heading.
After moving, the view is facing north again, so I need to rotate right to re-acquire the main building at ~61° NE for height estimation.
From this position and level pitch I can use visible storeys/windows as a scale reference, so I will provide a height estimate now.
